programme.desc: Dawson must make a tough decision about a father who is addicted to painkillers; Herrmann gets into an altercation with a police officer; Otis and Cruz go on a mission to find out who Brett is dating; Donna's brother unexpectedly comes to town.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Dawson asks Severide for help; Brett and Kidd compete for Zach's heart; Otis, Herrmann and Mouch try to figure out the source of a terrible stench wafting throughout the firehouse.

programme.desc: Dawson and Casey try to find Bria's whereabouts; Lt. Severide reunites with Chief Grissom; Cruz enlists the help of Brett and Mouch to create a new tool; Kidd and Zach go on a date.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: After responding to a time-sensitive rescue, Casey and Severide don't see eye to eye on the best course of action; Herrmann struggles to entertain his daughter while at work; Brett is joined by a surprise guest during a spa getaway.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: After photos of Casey and Severide jumping off the roof during a heroic rescue make the front page of the newspaper, Boden unwillingly agrees to have the photographer chronicle a day at the firehouse.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Chief Boden unwillingly agrees to let Dawson and Brett go under cover; Kidd and Zach's relationship hits a bump; Cruz has a hard time expressing his true feelings for Brett.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: After responding to a car accident, Casey and Dawson become skeptical when a domineering husband continues to answer for his injured wife; Cruz is frustrated with Herrmann and Mouch; Kidd uncovers something meaningful to Severide.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Otis and Kidd's lives are put in jeopardy when there's gunfire inside a house; Dawson comforts Brett during an especially trying time; Casey begins to notice that romance might be going on within the firehouse.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: The crew struggles to come to terms with an injury to one of their own; a temporary replacement must be dealt with; Boden ponders some interesting news; Kidd has a hard time keeping a secret.

programme.title: Chicago Fire

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett investigates a cold case that his grandfather and the famous Honolulu detective Chang Apana worked on in the 1940s; McGarrett and Danny get ready for the opening of their restaurant.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover's parents and brother arrive in Oahu for Thanksgiving; a thief is crushed to death by an empty safe.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.desc: Danny considers taking a new, more profitable job after investigating the death of a wealthy man; Nicky tries to avoid involving her family when she is sexually harassed by her boss at her new internship.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A man living a double life with two separate families is murdered; Erin asks Anthony to help investigate his former partner; Frank deliberates between two candidates for the chief of transit position.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny forces his brother-in-law to help Baez take down the mobsters he's mixed up with; Frank suspects his old partner is guilty of a crime; Jamie is approached by an officer who wants help getting reassigned from his undercover assignment.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A woman voices outrage over her son's unsolved murder; Danny re-examines the case; Eddie gets shot while on duty; Erin and her ex-husband face off in court; Frank deals with an angry police force after the mayor fails to defend it.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez race to find a missing girl who will die without her heart medication; Jamie and Eddie are on the wrong side of an investigation after engaging in a car chase; Sean wins an essay contest.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny resorts to asking his incarcerated archenemy for help locating a dangerous criminal who escaped from prison; Lugo refuses to assist unless he's allowed to accompany them on the pursuit; Frank tries to convince Jamie to take the sergeant's test.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank locks horns with a data-tracking company when it refuses to unlock a terrorist's phone that may hold information regarding upcoming targets; Erin obtains information about an impending murder from a shady source; a woman kidnaps a baby.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Browns running back Nick Chubb scored a 2-yard, go-ahead touchdown with 57 seconds left, and Steelers quarterback Russell Wilson's Hail Mary attempt was batted down in the end zone as time expired as Cleveland wins in the snow 24-19 over Pittsburgh.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Josh Allen tallies a passing, rushing and receiving touchdown on his stat sheet as the Bills rout the 49ers 35-10 in snow, and clinch AFC East.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Saquon Barkley dashed through the snow for two touchdown runs and finished with 205 yards rushing, Jalen Hurts had a 44-yard scoring run and the Eagles held on against the turnover-happy Rams 28-22 on Sunday to reach the NFC championship game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Christian Benford intercepted Joe Burrow's toss and returned it 63 yards for a go-ahead touchdown with 5:25 left, Josh Allen threw for 3 touchdowns and ran in another, and the Buffalo Bills beat the Cincinnati Bengals 39-34 on a snowy Sunday.

programme.title: Fox College Football - Mountain West Championship: UNLV vs Boise St.
programme.desc: Boise State faces UNLV for the third straight time in the Mountain West Conference title game. The six-time MWC champion Broncos beat the Rebels 44-20 in 2023, and 21-7 in 2024. UNLV quarterback Anthony Colandrea has created 30 TDs this season.

programme.title: Fox College Football - Big Ten Championship: Indiana vs Ohio St.
programme.desc: The nation's only two undefeated programs face off in the Big Ten championship game as Indiana plays Ohio State for the CFP's top seed. The Buckeyes seek a record 25th outright conference crown. The Hoosiers have not won a title since 1967.

Before any bullets fly, however, Lot and his intended enemy strike up an unlikely friendship, and Blaine tries to convince the youngster to call off the shootout. Unfortunately, Lot can't be talked out of his quest for glory and so he guns down a few hostile locals, leaving Blaine no choice but to finally accept the offer for a showdown.

As life continues in the mountains, Johnson finds himself a native bride (Delle Bolton) and an adopted son (Josh Albee). However, their peaceful existence is threatened when Johnson incurs the ire of the Crow Indians.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There is work to be done in and around the pond this week, and Monty also begins planting out his dahlias. Adding zing to the month of May is the euphorbia, and Carol Klein visits Oxford Botanic garden to view their extensive collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on herbs which will grow happily in shade and has an unusual choice for his summer containers, bananas. Earlier this year, Monty paid a visit to Chatsworth House to find out about the history of the extensive grounds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty adds a touch of the exotic to the damp garden by planting a tree fern, and protects his new soft fruit garden from feathered predators with netting. Also Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her June `Plant of the Month'.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty in Longmeadow and adds more medicinal planting to the herb garden, especially those that the bees love. Rachel also investigates how we can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don continues work in his courtyard, where he gives advice on plants which thrive on shady walls, sows root crops in the vegetable garden and catches up on work in his cottage garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We are in Marathon, the heart of the Florida Keys, where crystal-clear waters meet charming island vibes. Known for its pristine dive sites, rich marine life, and welcoming locals, Marathon offers some of the best underwater adventures in the world.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With human populations scattered through the landscape, human-wildlife conflict is a common occurrence in Borneo. Dan Cabela travels to the area to participate in an ambitious elephant collaring project, hoping to better understand how people and elephants can live harmoniously.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Chef Dave in the Golden Ilse to target Reds and Trout. Then head to Halyards to cook the catch.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Giant snook call this coastal town home. Watch along as Jay gets his hands on one.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Watch along as Jay learns to clean fish from ‪@reedthefishmonger‬. Watch the full video and learn to clean any fish.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Capt Josh and Johnny from Johnny Jigs head out with gorgeous weather on their side to hit some reefs and put the jigs to work!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: They say you come to New Zealand as a stranger, but leave as family. In this episode of DIRT, the crew goes full circle—meeting Muttonbird chefs Emma and George on the South Island before hopping up to Raglan and working their way back down. Water skiing next to snow-capped mountains, cooking in hot springs the Māori way, and stargazing at Wairarapa Dark Sky Reserve are all on the itinerary. But it’s the final “Feed” done Kiwi-style that makes one thing clear—in this unique and stunning land, nobody’s a stranger for long.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: “Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it.” -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: After a tough go at it in Oklahoma, Rigsby Stewart gets back to his home turf in East Georgia. This turkey gobbled his head off! Sweet redemption in the Georgia Pines!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Michael Pitts is joined by competition caller and call-maker Anthony Virga, as well as Cole Barthel. It's the first hunt of the year for the Realtree Road Trips crew.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Bryan Brown hunt down at Honey Brake Lodge in Jonesville, Louisiana. Honey Brake is known for it's duck hunting, but because of WRP management practices, big buck habitat has been created. Did Drew Keith's doe decoy idea really work? Find out now!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Realtree's Chipper Jones bow hunts Kansas whitetails during the late rut.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Atlanta Braves' third baseman Austin Riley is usually spending his September and October holding it down on the hot corner in the MLB playoffs. Being that he can't hunt much during the early part of deer season, he usually hunts hard during December and January in Mississippi. This year was no different. He jumped at the opportunity to head down to the Backwoods testing grounds to hunt with the Small Town TV crew in Yazoo City. Austin capitalizes on a first sit opportunity on a true Mississippi giant over a Backwoods Attraction food plot! Three first sit bucks taken for the Road Trips crew at the Backwoods testing grounds!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man

Follow along as we turn a old beat up piece of dirt and turn it into the ultimate place ground for a hunter such as myself. From habitat to harvest we have been on fire.

programme.desc: Josh Dahlke, a lifelong big game hunter, never imagined he would ever get the chance to hunt Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep. But then he found a way. Watch his hunt of a lifetime unfold in the first part of this HuntStand Original Film.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting wild hogs at night with thermal optics is a unique thrill. But even in prime pig country, catching up with night swine can be a serious challenge. Feral hogs are cagey and unpredictable—they read no scripts—and they'll definitely keep you on the edge of your seat as you wait for the perfect opportunity to make bacon.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke, a lifelong big game hunter, never imagined he would ever get the chance to hunt Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep. But then he found a way. Watch his hunt of a lifetime unfold in the second part of this HuntStand Original Film.

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear
programme.desc: The Venom X from TenPoint is the company’s lightest and lowest-priced ACUslide crossbow ever. It weighs in at 6.9-pounds and measures 9.75-inches wide. And it's loaded with features.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After a 5-year hiatus from vertical bowhunting, Josh Dahlkegets a phone call from a friend that compels him to pick up a compound bowagain and prepare for a bucket-list hunt. Dahlke and Mike Mattly head to thelegendary Gila region of New Mexico to go after rutting bull elk. But they’reonce again reminded that bowhunting is often a long game, with no guarantees—even if you’re hunting in one of the best elk units in the country

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. programme.title: Hunting Land Man

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the back, back-country where even the fish struggle to find water.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: On a crisp Iowa November morning, everything comes together as Drake Lamb with Midwest Whitetail grunts in a massive 8-point buck that he encountered before with the WoodHaven Midwest Grunter. This is one hunt you don’t want to miss!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Hunsucker of Heartland Bowhunter returns to a familiar ranch he’s helped manage for years, chasing a legendary buck nicknamed “Buddy.”

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey has always had one dream as a land owner, and after over a decade of managing his Illinois farm, his dream finally came true—a MEGA 200" giant buck! This story began three years ago when Jeff passed on this deer at just 26 yards. Back then, he was a 175" 4.5-year-old stud, but he took a gamble and let him walk... hoping he’d one day break the magical 200" mark.

programme.desc: They say you come to New Zealand as a stranger, but leave as family. In this episode of DIRT, the crew goes full circle—meeting Muttonbird chefs Emma and George on the South Island before hopping up to Raglan and working their way back down. Water skiing next to snow-capped mountains, cooking in hot springs the Māori way, and stargazing at Wairarapa Dark Sky Reserve are all on the itinerary. But it’s the final “Feed” done Kiwi-style that makes one thing clear—in this unique and stunning land, nobody’s a stranger for long.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: “Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it.” -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: After a tough go at it in Oklahoma, Rigsby Stewart gets back to his home turf in East Georgia. This turkey gobbled his head off! Sweet redemption in the Georgia Pines!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Realtree's Chipper Jones bow hunts Kansas whitetails during the late rut.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Atlanta Braves' third baseman Austin Riley is usually spending his September and October holding it down on the hot corner in the MLB playoffs. Being that he can't hunt much during the early part of deer season, he usually hunts hard during December and January in Mississippi. This year was no different. He jumped at the opportunity to head down to the Backwoods testing grounds to hunt with the Small Town TV crew in Yazoo City. Austin capitalizes on a first sit opportunity on a true Mississippi giant over a Backwoods Attraction food plot! Three first sit bucks taken for the Road Trips crew at the Backwoods testing grounds!

programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After a 5-year hiatus from vertical bowhunting, Josh Dahlkegets a phone call from a friend that compels him to pick up a compound bowagain and prepare for a bucket-list hunt. programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: Tight Spot
programme.desc: A lawyer springs a wise-cracking model from jail to convince her to testify against a no-good mobster, but a besotted cop throws a wrench in the plan.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend’s marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: Queen Bee
programme.desc: A naive, working-class Chicagoan enters a world of bitter jealousy and manipulative power plays when invited to Atlanta by her socialite elder cousin.

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts
programme.desc: A fearless sailor returns to the kingdom of Thessaly after a 20-year voyage to find the Golden Fleece and make his rightful claim to the throne.

programme.title: Our Man in Havana
programme.desc: A vacuum cleaner salesman is recruited as a spy by the British secret service. Despite his phony reports and lies, he quickly gains importance.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: Our Wife
programme.desc: A composer (Melvyn Douglas) goes on a cruise and meets a woman (Ruth Hussey) he likes more than his wife (Ellen Drew).

programme.title: Loss of Innocence
programme.desc: Left alone because of their mother's sudden hospitalization during a vacation in France, four British children have to fend for themselves. They stay at a hotel, where, despite the reticence of owner Madame Zisi (Danielle Darrieux), they are befriended by her lover, Eliot (Kenneth More). Joss (Susannah York), the eldest of the children, runs afoul of Madame Zisi, who thinks Eliot is spending too much time with her and causes a scene. Robbed of Eliot's attention, Joss denounces him to the police.

programme.title: Bad for Each Other
programme.desc: Wooed by a Pittsburgh socialite, an idealistic doctor from a mining town is torn between helping his community and lucrative work at an elite clinic.

programme.title: Pushover
programme.desc: To get the lowdown on stolen cash, a duty-bound cop makes a move on the girlfriend of a murderous bank robber and accidentally falls for her.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) tries to stop an Army scout and a band of outlaws from starting an American Indian war.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: Pecos River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) catch mail robbers.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Beyond the Sacramento

programme.title: The Desperadoes
programme.desc: Sheriff Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is a devoted lawman who works tirelessly to keep order in his small town, nestled within the Utah territory. So, when Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), an old friend with a criminal past, rolls into town, Upton is immediately on edge. Cheyenne assures his pal that all that's behind him now. But when the town bank is robbed, Cheyenne becomes the locals' number one suspect. He'll have to prove his innocence to save himself and his friend's reputation.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon

programme.title: Man in the Saddle

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual ‘Paramount Dance Extravaganza’. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's three weeks into the winter season in Northern Alaska, and Carlile Transportation has only moved 500 of the 2,000 loads it needs to transport to the Prudhoe Bay oil fields.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A massive storm blows in and all traffic on the ice road comes to a standstill. And if wheels aren't turning, no one's earning. George, Tim and Lisa take shelter at Coldfoot.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Another winter storm drops nearly a foot of fresh, new snow, obscuring the road south.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Warming temperatures are causing overflows all over the ice road, and with water rushing through cracks in the ice, hauling loads just got a lot more dangerous.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Hugh and Eric are neck-in-neck in their race to claim dominance over the ice road, but with only days before the end of the season.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Day 1 of the new Ice Road season begins. There are 6,000 loads of freight to move in just 12 weeks to the oil camps of Alaska's North Slope.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: On Alaska's North Slope, a new ice road season has just begun. Carlile Transportation has less than three months to haul 2,000 loads from Fairbanks to Deadhorse.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's three weeks into the winter season in Northern Alaska, and Carlile Transportation has only moved 500 of the 2,000 loads it needs to transport to the Prudhoe Bay oil fields.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Lisa Kelly auditions to be the first woman to break into the elite Heavy Haul division by commanding a convoy of pilot cars while hauling 80-foot sections of wide-gauge pipe.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The race is on to make it to Prudhoe before a wicked storm turns fierce.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A deadly combination of unpredictable weather on the North Slope has made Atigun Pass more dangerous than ever.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: With just three weeks to go, everyone is pushing it to the limit to get the freight to Deadhorse before the season ends. Lisa rushes to Carlile to pick up her next load.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: There's only two weeks left to pull in the big bucks and get all the loads to the oil fields.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The drivers are pushed to their limits when they must shuttle critical supplies to the oil camps of Alaska's North Slope.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Tim's got a big problem on his hands. One of his clients, Owen, has failed to appear in court. He's on bond for serious drug charges and now Tim could lose $30,000 if he doesn't catch Owen.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Upset because one his puppies may die and wanting to give the little guy a second chance in life, Dog decides to offer one of the fugitives a second chance, too.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: As Dog likes to say, "it's not the years it's the miles," and this goes for both men and machines. Those long hunts and the rides to jail take a toll not only on Dog but also on his vehicles.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, taking the day off to try his hand at coaching, assigns Tim and Leland to track down Emmanuel, a fugitive with terminal cancer who's got nothing to lose by running. Can the boys prove to Dog and Beth that they can handle a difficult job on their own?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble--or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the Chapman clan start their hunt today.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Before Tim heads out for a tough day of bounty hunting, he likes to get in a little quality time with his daughter, Summer Rain. This morning, he takes the toddler for a spin around the yard in her little red wagon.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Hunting down a fugitive known as "Bozo," Dog gets help from an unexpected source - Bozo's father-in-law. When they find Bozo, he protests his wife-beating charge, saying he never hit her with his fist, only his open hand.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been quite a while since Tim Chapman put down his mace can and bulletproof vest to care for his growing family. When his old friend Dog calls asking for help tracking an elusive felon Tim jumps into action.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Delaware woman vanished in 1996, family and friends discovered her secret life. The appointments secretary to the Governor had carried on an illicit affair with a wealthy married man. Agents suspected that her powerful ex-lover was responsible, but they had little physical evidence to support their theory. Investigators never found the woman's body or the murder weapon. The FBI's only hope was to go undercover, and turn brother against brother.

programme.title: Los archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: From May until July of 1984, Alton Coleman and his common law wife, Denise Brown, engaged in a gruesome crime spree that spanned six states and left eight people dead including children. The FBI coordinated law enforcement efforts throughout the entire country in order to track the couple. Their expertise in conducting manhunts for the nation's most horrible killers paid off. The couple was located and apprehended as they prepared to kill again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980s, the decapitation of a young African-American male led the Miami-Dade police department and the FBI along a trail of murder. Investigators quickly discovered that the victim was a dissident member of a religious sect headed by a man calling himself Yahweh ben Yahweh, or God, Son of God. Although the FBI believed Yahweh ben Yahweh and his followers were responsible for many murders, they could find no direct evidence linking them to the crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A young mother and her infant son mysteriously disappeared from their home. The woman's husband was the only suspect, but he was eventually cleared. There was no solid evidence that a crime had even been committed. Six months later, a local farmer found the remains of the missing woman and her child. Both had been murdered. Agents and local police had only one tiny piece of evidence, an unidentified hair found in the murdered woman's car. The hair was too small for analysis.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: The rapes and murders of ten women near Tampa, Florida in 1984 had the authorities puzzled and the community scared. Since the beginning, the FBI had been analyzing the crime scene evidence and had found a common link: red trilobal carpet fibers. But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: Los archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extraño secuestró a Polly Klaas de doce años durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entró en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitación y descubrieron, a través del uso de fuentes de luz láser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Después de una extensa investigación de dos meses, el FBI arrestó a Richard Allen Davis. La impresión de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February of 1996, New Jersey millionaire Frank Black flew to Florida to close a major business deal before retiring. He never came home. Authorities in New Jersey sensed foul play and brought in the FBI. Agents learned of a mystery woman in Florida who was to meet Black. Phone records showed a flood of calls to Black from his business rival just before the disappearance.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Delaware woman vanished in 1996, family and friends discovered her secret life. The appointments secretary to the Governor had carried on an illicit affair with a wealthy married man. Agents suspected that her powerful ex-lover was responsible, but they had little physical evidence to support their theory. Investigators never found the woman's body or the murder weapon. The FBI's only hope was to go undercover, and turn brother against brother.

But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A stranger snatched an eight-year-old girl as she played in her Tucson, Arizona neighborhood, leaving behind an abandoned bicycle and a frantic mother. Hundreds of citizens and police officers fanned out across the region, hoping to find some trace of the young girl or her abductor. Within hours, a suspect emerged; a drifter who was out on parole for abducting and molesting children. He was nowhere to be found and time had run out for the innocent child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: From May until July of 1984, Alton Coleman and his common law wife, Denise Brown, engaged in a gruesome crime spree that spanned six states and left eight people dead including children. The FBI coordinated law enforcement efforts throughout the entire country in order to track the couple. Their expertise in conducting manhunts for the nation's most horrible killers paid off. The couple was located and apprehended as they prepared to kill again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A young mother and her infant son mysteriously disappeared from their home. The woman's husband was the only suspect, but he was eventually cleared. There was no solid evidence that a crime had even been committed. Six months later, a local farmer found the remains of the missing woman and her child. Both had been murdered. Agents and local police had only one tiny piece of evidence, an unidentified hair found in the murdered woman's car. The hair was too small for analysis.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 26, 1993, an explosion rocked the World Trade Center parking garage. Six people died and more than a thousand were injured in the bomb blast that tore a 5-story crater in the building. During the investigation, the twisted fender of a rental van was extracted from the rubble. The FBI was able to determine from where the van was rented and by whom. Undercover agents then made their arrests within six days of the bombing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: Los archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He wandered the streets of New York City wearing only pajamas and a bathrobe, but the FBI was convinced that Vince Gigante, the reputed boss of the Genovese crime family, was anything but crazy. The FBI used undercover surveillance, secret audio tapes, six mobsters turned government informants and the testimony of twelve FBI agents to help convict Gigante of murder and conspiracy-to-murder, including a plot to kill rival mob boss John Gotti.
